binary.name: rtcfit
binary.syntax: rtcfit [-vb] [-mp minpwr] [-L logname] [-p pathname] [-if pidname] host port
rtcfit -rpf [-vb] [-mp minpwr] [-L logname] [-p pathname] [-if pidname] host portname

option.od: print the help message and exit.
print the RST version number and exit.
verbose. Log information to the console.
filter out data with values of lag-zero power less than minpwr.
log connections and information in the file logname. By default, connections are recorded in log.rt.
store the daily files in the directory pathname.
record the process Identifier (PID) of the server in the file pidname. By default, the PID is recorded in pid.id.
hostname or IP number of the system to connect to.
port number to connect to on the server.
The remote port number is stored in a text file.
filename of the text file containing the remote port number.

synopsis.p: Creates a cFit format file from a fitacf TCP/IP data stream.

description.p: Creates a cFit format file from a fitacf TCP/IP data stream.
The data is written to a file called "yyyymmdd.iii.cfit" where yyyy is the year, mm is the month, dd is the day, and iii is the radar identifier code.

example.description: Generates cfit files from the host "kapqnx.jhuapl.edu", served at port 1024. The process identifier is recorded in the file "pid.id", and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.yyyymmdd" where yyyy is the year, mm is the month, and dd is the day.

Generates cfit files from the host "kapqnx.jhuapl.edu", served at port contained in the file "port.kap". The process identifier is recorded in the file "pid.id", and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.yyyymmdd" where yyyy is the year, mm is the month, and dd is the day.
